Barb mentioned the jiujitsu guy in the recent episode of the NHk Taiga
beating poor Saitou.  It got me thinking abou the Sekiguti/Sekiguchi
jiujitsu S.H. believed to have practiced.  On one of the posts at
3-hajime.com

fish says...
"Saito one Sekiguti style [jiujitsu lineage/style] softly had
completed technique, because the history charge supporting is not
clear, assertion is not possible, but because it is the information
where the Akama Cipango [Akama Shizuko] child person is procured from
the Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department, as for the possibility it is
high with you think. Because Tadasi Matsubara softly seems that is
softly the master of technique of the extent which serves the
technique teacher head afterwards, being taken after, is not strange,
don't you think?"

so the info is from the TMPD.  The Sekiguti style was mentioned on the
S.H.'s chart http://g1342122.at.infoseek.co.jp/ 
And I think the guy in the NHK drama was Tadasi Matsubara--master of
his style(?)  his name pops up in other threads regarding the drama. 
Indeed the guys in the Shinsengumi were skilled as is ...and due to
the varied demographics of the group they continued to broaden their
martial knowledge obviously. I just found it pretty neat how Akama S.
was able to find this shred of info.
